author: jeffrey.downard
title: DIDs for Health Records
description: How to promote widespread adoption of Atala Prism for health records?

f6_assessments.q0: The foundation of this proposal is very well grounded. Creating a small-scale DID system for a certain group of pet owners and then gradually increasing the database and adding pet classes until it expands to cover the entire vet records so it can prove valuable for use in the human health records system is a very sound starting point in expanding the growth of the Cardano network.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has provided sufficient details regarding their experience and together with the well composed plan I find the project can be implemented successfully. The team plans on starting on a small scale at first and observe how efficiently the adoption will grow, which is a very good path to a productive long-term project.
f6_assessments.q2: The timeline and budget provided are sensible, the team is not rushing into building the system, they have allocated time and money for the research and setting up the foundation for the project, setting the path for a robust proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: I believe after Phase I (one), the clear road map would be vision-able before integrating into human DID direction.
f6_assessments.q1: Suitable approach with pets for vet voluntarily and moving into human records. However, your Board of Advisory should address any ethical issue that involves collecting and storing some per cent of 85 million family records on the Cardano backend. You should have a clear roadmap in Phase I to reach your listed outcomes. For instance, what are the expected outcomes in "Month 1-2: Workshops"
f6_assessments.q2: Should have provided better and upfront info on how Cardano ecosystem and Atala PRISM users and developers would benefit from your project's outcomes, as well as how to monitor the project progress in Phase I (one). I believe you would apply for Phase II and III so on. Therefore, I hope you would disclose small parts of the design, sample codes, datasets etc., so those starting on a similar approach would learn the mistakes (if any) or re-design your module into their own at an accelerated pace.

f6_assessments.q0:
It is an enormous impact on C.A. time to read and forensic each of your team projects and vCA time reading these comments more than 10 times again and over again.
Total fund requested $320100 of 12 proposals (inc two shell proposals, proposal number 11 and 12 listed in Feasibility). 
I could sum up three main areas that all of your 10 submitted projects as follow: 1) introduce PRISM + Cardano by using Youtube, website and workshops as delivery channels 2) developing PRISM at gathering data rather than an essential tool in Phase I (6 months) and 3) some intangible legal involving.

Most proposals paraphrased each other with minimal change. Here is one example. 

For example, Defining Success of 1) and 2) below are only difference "roadmap that small cities" vs 
"schematic model that" and the rest are IDENTICAL—the same fashion for the rest of the 12 proposals.
 
1) DIDs for Cities https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/DIDs-for-Cities/382636-48088
"Creation of a schematic model that use in the adoption of Atala Prism ID system. 
Development of webpage on the Kepler SCS website with videos presenting a narrative of the community conversation as citizens learn about the opportunities to create and take ownership of a secure digital I.D."

2) DIDs for Health Records https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/DIDs-for-Health-Records/382633-48088
"Creation of a roadmap that small cities can use in the adoption of Atala Prism ID system. Development of webpage on the Kepler SCS website with videos presenting a narrative of the community conversation as citizens learn about the opportunities to create and take ownership of a secure digital I.D."
f6_assessments.q1:
With 12 proposals for six months to do similar outcomes such as data gathering, workshops and legal advice, I do not believe these projects would address and expand Cardano and PRISM aggressively and can be deliverable with the listed team members. Here is the list of 12 similar proposals submitted by the same team.

f6_assessments.q2:
Time and budget are close (copied/pasted) to the identical pattern with no detail and slightly differ in Dollar and not support-base and expected outcomes. There is no precise mechanism for Project Catalyst and the challenge team to follow and monitor your 10 proposals (minus 2 shell proposals).

Here is a summary "Time and Budget" pattens used in 10 submitted projects with the listed team member, Law Professor.

Phase I (6 months)

Month 1: some type of "outreach" (vary $$)
Month 1-2: "Workshops" (vary $$)
Month 2: Webpage development and and Youtube channel related (vary $$)
Months 2-3: identify the issue (vary $$)
Project direction:  (vary $$)
Project oversight and evaluation by members of Board of Advisors months 1-5: (vary $$)
Legal work on guidelines for the roadmap (vary $$)
Total: (vary $$)

Phase II (6-9)
Phase III (10-12)

f6_assessments.q0: I strongly agree this proposal addresses the challenge since it aims to create vet records for pets using Atala PRISM. If this system will be run well, it could be a repeatable pattern for the development of integration of IDs.
f6_assessments.q1: The development plan is clearly written with broken-down budget. I'm glad to see the team has horse trainer, dog breeder and also a board of advisers. The only thing that makes me concern is that the team has only David Watts having experience in technical field, therefore, the scope work for him could be very heavy.
f6_assessments.q2: I think this proposal provides me pretty enough information to audit its progress and success. Roadmap with milestone is crearly planned. I advice team that some of KPIs should be estimated and added.

solution: Start with owners of pets for vet records. Then, transition from pet health records to human health records.
experience: Business law, non-profit law, tax law, teaching law, developer, business systems consultant, Full Stack Dev, Plutus and Atala-Prism pilot.
